c74object.name: the.jit.gl.cc.comp
c74object.digest: Apply color correction to incoming texture
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2022, www.xenorama.com.
Adjust output color using a combined jit.gl.slab shader with the functionality of native jit.scalebias, jit.brcosa, jit.rgb2luma and an equivalent of jit.charmap on the GPU.

attribute.name: scale
attribute.description:
The RGBA scale values (default = 1. 1. 1. 1.)
Based on params of jit.scalebias.

attribute.name: bias
attribute.description:
The RGBA bias values (default = 0. 0. 0. 0.)
Based on params of jit.scalebias.

attribute.name: brightness
attribute.description:
Brightness (default = 1.). Values below 1. (to 0.) reduce brightness, while values above 1. increase it.
1. represents no change.
Based on params of jit.brcosa.

attribute.name: contrast
attribute.description:
Contrast (default = 1.) Values below 1. (to 0.) decrease contrast, bringing the image closer to grey (which represents the average luminance of the image frame). Values above 1.0 increase contrast. 1.0 represents no change. Negative values affect a color inversion, but with similar results.
Based on params of jit.brcosa.

attribute.name: saturation
attribute.description:
Saturation (default = 1.) Values below 1. (to 0.) decrease saturation, bringing the image closer to greyscale. Values above 1. increase saturation. 1. represents no change. Negative values affect a color inversion, but with similar results.
Based on params of jit.brcosa.

attribute.name: avgluma
attribute.description:
Average RGBA luminocity
Based on params of jit.brcosa.

attribute.name: bw
attribute.description:
Amount of overall monochrome (black and white) containing the luminosity of the original texture using the equation L = (.299 * R value) + (.587 * G value) + (.114 * B value).
This immitates the behaviour of jit.rgb2luma in a texture shader.

attribute.name: colormap
attribute.description:
Creates a 256-point input to output map. Input values are replaced by the corresponding output value. See the colormap_mode for details.
This immitates the behaviour of jit.charmap in a texture shader.

attribute.name: colormap_mode
attribute.description: Input to output map mode when colormap is enabled. By default, this flag is set to "0" (table). When set to "1", input to output map can be specified using native function objects in the object GUI. Note that the mapping can only be applied using the graphical user interface, not by means of messages.

attribute.name: bypass
attribute.description: Bypass color correction. By default, bypass is disalbed ("0").
